Free CSS Validation Service

October 04, 2007

I have sometimes been pulling my hair out as why a certain page element isn’t displaying as it should and quite often this can be down to an easily typed and difficult to spot syntax error in your CSS file. When I come across such unexplainable problems I regularly validate my CSS just to make sure – it’s also good practice to do so regardless!

Validate your site CSS file(s) with the following free validation service from the goodfellah’s at the W3C. You can validate it against different versions of the CSS standard, the medium for which the sylesheet is to be embedded to and various different warning reports, so blaze away on the link below! You can even place a CSS valid button on your site and everything when you are valid – which is nice.

The W3C CSS Validation Service

PS – This site is CSS valid, naturally!

Need a web site for your organisation? Contact Ai New Media for a quote.
